properties.title: Birth in Suyab
properties.modern-name: Chuy Region, Kyrgyzstan

properties.title: Growing up in Qinglian
properties.historic-name: Qinglian Village (青莲镇), Changming County (昌明), Sichuan (四川)
properties.modern-name: Qinglian (青莲镇), Jiangyou County (江油市), Sichuan (四川省)

properties.title: Learning from Zhao Rui at Changping Mountain
properties.historic-name: Changping Mountain (长坪山), Zi Prefecture (梓州), Sichuan (四川)
properties.modern-name: Changping Mountain (长坪山)， San Tai (三台县), Sichuan (四川省)

properties.title: Learning from Monk Jun at Mount Emei
properties.historic-name: Whitewater Temple (白水寺), Mount Emei (峨眉山), Yi Prefecture (益州), Sichuan (四川)
properties.modern-name: Wannian Temple (万年寺), Mount Emei (峨眉山), Leshan (乐山市), Sichuan (四川省)
poem-notable-zh-cn: 蜀僧抱绿绮,西下峨眉峰。
为我挥一手,如听万壑松。
客心洗流水,余响入霜钟。
不觉碧山暮,秋云暗几重。
poem-trans-hajin-en: The monk in Shu holds his lute
Sitting below the peak of Emei Mountain
For me, he plucks away while I hear
The wind shaking the pines in the valley.
My soul is again cleansed afresh
As the lingering sound is still touching
The bell glazed with autumn frost.
I haven't noticed the green mountain
Cloaked in the sunset as the clouds
Turn darker than a moment ago.
properties.poem-trans-title-hajin-en: Listening to Monk Jun Play the Lute

properties.title: Seeking appointment in Chengdu
properties.historic-name: Chengdu (成都), Yi Prefecture (益州), Sichuan (四川)
properties.modern-name: Chengdu (成都市), Sichuan (四川省)

properties.title: Seeking appointment in Chongqing
properties.historic-name: Chongqing (重庆), Yu Prefecture (渝州), Sichuan (四川)
properties.modern-name: Chongqing (重庆市), Sichuan (四川省)

properties.title: Back to hometown in Changming
properties.modern-name: Jiangyou County (江油市), Sichuan (四川省)

properties.title: Travelling through Chu and Wu Enroute to Seeking a Post
properties.modern-name: Wanzhou District (万州区), Chonqing Municipality (重庆市)
poem-trans-hajin-en: The autumn moon is rising, halfway out of Emei Mountain,
Its shadows floating on the Qiang's currents.
Tonight we left Qingxi, heading for the Three Gorges,
And I miss you, but have to sail down to Yuzhou.

properties.title: Visiting Sima Chengzhen
properties.historic-name: Jiangling (江陵), Jing Prefecture (荆州), Chu (楚) region
properties.modern-name: Jiangling County (江陵县), Hubei (湖北省)

properties.title: Seeing Cui Hao's Poem at the Yellow Crane Tower
properties.modern-name: Yellow Crane Jetty (黄鹤楼), Xinzhou (新洲区), Wuhan (武汉市), Hubei (湖北省)

properties.title: Wandering East with Friends
properties.modern-name: Mount Lu (庐山), Jiujiang (九江市), Jiangxi Province (江西省)
companion: Buddhist monks from East Woods Temple
poem-trans-hajin-en: The sun shines on the Burner Peak, raising purple smoke.
Look, far away a waterfall hangs on the river ahead,
Its stream flying down three thousand feet.
I wonder if it's the Milky Way descending from heaven.

properties.title: Looking for Patronage in Jinling
properties.historic-name: Jinling (金陵), the land of Wu
properties.modern-name: Nanjing (南京市), Jiangsu (江苏省)
poem-trans-hajin-en: Whose daughter is this girl in the east of Jinling?
I listen to her music rising from a curtained window.
She's like a flowered cloud that fell from heaven
And she floats with her lover across the western river.
She sings in the Wu dialect, but her soft voice accented,
And this imperfection makes her sing with more feelng.
I think of Master Xie who took girls from Eastern Hill
Through all the woods and mountains and streams.

properties.title: Sick and Destitute in Yangzhou
properties.modern-name: Yangzhou (扬州市), Jiangsu (江苏省)
poem-trans-hajin-en: Moonlight spreads before my bed.
I wonder if it's hoarfrost on the ground.
I raise my head to watch the moon
And lowering it, I think of home.

properties.title: Visiting the reclusive Meng Haoran
properties.modern-name: Xiangyang (襄阳市), Hubei (湖北省)
poem-trans-hajin-en: I love Master Meng,
Whose gallantry is known everywhere.
When young, he despised carriages and crowns;
White-haired, he lounges against pines and clouds.
In moonlit nights he gets drunk in an elegant manner
And possessed by flowers, he. won't serve the emperor.
I can't praise enough this man who's like a high mountain,
So all I can do is clasp my hands to show my respect.

properties.title: Marrying into the Xu Family
properties.modern-name: Anlu (安陆市), Hubei Province (湖北省)
properties.poem-trans-title-hajin-en: At Yellow Crane Tower, Seeing Meng Haoran Leaving for Guangling
poem-trans-hajin-en: My friend is sailing east, away from Yellow Crane Tower.
Through the March blossoms he is going down to Yangzhou.
His sail casts a single  shadow in the distance, then disappears,
Nothing  but the Yangtze  flowing on the edge of the sky.
properties.poem-notable-title-zh-cn: 黄鹤楼送孟浩然之广陵

properties.title: Seeking Civil Service in the Capital
properties.modern-name: Xi'an (西安), Shaanxi Province (陕西省)

properties.title: Wandering In and Out of the Capital
properties.modern-name: Zhongnan Mountain (终南山)
Anlu (安陆市), Hubei Province (湖北省)
properties.title: Returning to His Wife, Disappointed

properties.modern-name: Taiyuan (太原市), Shanxi Province (山西省)
properties.title: Dissuaded from military service at the northern frontier
poem-trans-hajin-en: The northern horses don't think of the south
Where animals cannot long for the north.
Their indigenous habitats have shaped
Their habits and lives.
Long ago we came out of Goose Pass
And ever since have stayed in the barbarous land.
Sandstorms distort the view of the sun and the steppes
And flying snow blocks the foreign sky.
Lice infest our clothes and leather mail,
Yet we resolve to keep our banners aloft.
So many bitter battles won but without rewards
Our devotion never recognized.
Who has ever taken pity on General Li the Swift,
Who lost his white head in the desert?

properties.title: Travelling South along the Coast
properties.modern-name: Hangzhou

properties.title: Mourning the death of Meng Haoran and Commiserating with Wang Changling
properties.historic-name: Dongting Lake (洞庭湖), Baling Town (巴陵)
properties.modern-name: Dongting Lake (洞庭湖),Yueyang (岳阳市), Hunan Province (湖南省)

properties.title: Becoming a Father
properties.modern-name: Anlu (安陆市), Hubei Province (湖北省)

properties.title: Moving the Family to the Lu Region
properties.historic-name: Xiaqiu County (瑕丘), Lu Prefecture (廬州)
properties.modern-name: Yanzhou (兖州), Shandong Province (山东省)
companion: Woman of Lu (鲁一妇女) (third partner)
poem-trans-hajin-en: The fine wine of Lanling gives off a fragrance-
Held in a jade bowl, it shines with amber light.
So long as the host can make me drunk
I'll have no idea where my hometown is

properties.title: Emperor Xuanzong summons Li to the Imperial Academy
properties.modern-name: Xi'an (西安市), Shaanxi Province (陕西省)

properties.title: Two Great Poets Meet: Befriending Du Fu
properties.modern-name: Luoyang (洛阳市), Henan Province (河南省)
poem-trans-hajin-en: At the top of Fanke Mountain I run into Du Fu,
He dons a straw hat in the vertical sunbeams.
I ask him why he's thinner than when we last met.
He says he's been working hard on his poems.

properties.title: Being inducted into Daoist Society
properties.modern-name: Jinan (济南市), Shandong Province (山东省)
companion: Grand Master Gao Rugui (高如貴)(Daoist master)

properties.title: Returning Home and Working on Immortality Pills
properties.historic-name: Xiaqiu County (瑕丘), Lu Prefecture (廬州)
properties.modern-name: Yanzhou (兖州), Shandong Province (山东省)
companion: Woman of Lu (鲁一妇女)(third partner)
poem-trans-hajin-en: Human happiness is similar to those dreams.
Since ancient times
Everything  has been like the flowing water
That will never return.
Friends, I am leaving now,
But when will I come back again?
For now I've sent the white stag in the green mountain
When I travel, I will ride it to legendary hills.
How could I drop my eyes and bow
To the rich and powerful,
Not letting myself smile and laught at will!
properties.poem-trans-title-hajin-en: Singing of my Visit to Mount Tianlo in My Dreams

properties.modern-name: Nanjing (南京市), Jiangsu (江苏省)
properties.title: Wandering South like a Diety
poem-trans-hajin-en: On the Phoenix Terrace phoenixes once roamed,
But now the birds are gone
And only an empty terrace spreads on the flowing river.
Grass and flowers cover the silent paths at the Wu Palace
While the crowns and gowns of the Ji dynasty
Are all buried in their ancient graves.
Three hills stand beyond the clear sky
As a band of water divides the Isle of White Heron.
Hovering clouds can always block the sun
And the absence of Chang'an gives me grief.
properties.poem-trans-title-hajin-en: Ascending the Phoenix Terrace in Jinling

properties.title: Remarrying to Miss Zong
properties.modern-name: Kaifeng (开封市), Henan Province (河南省)
properties.poem-notable-title-zh-cn: 送内寻庐山女道士李腾空
poem-trans-hajin-en: If you look for Master Tengkong
You should go to her cottage in the green mountain.
She is ladling water for making the elixir of life
While a breeze sways heather flowers nearby.
If you like her remote quiet dwelling,
You should stay here, caressing purple clouds with her.
properties.poem-trans-title-hajin-en: Accompanying My Wife to Look for Master Li Tengkong In Mount Lu

properties.title: Visiting Yuan Danqiu
properties.modern-name: Nanyang (南阳市), Henan (河南省)

properties.title: Deciding Against Joining An Lushan's Army
properties.modern-name: Beijing (北京市)
properties.historic-name: City of Ji (蓟), You Prefecture (幽州)

properties.title: Withdrawing from Politics
properties.modern-name: Xuancheng (宣城市), Anhui Province (安徽省)
properties.poem-notable-title-zh-cn: 宣州谢朓楼饯别校书叔云
poem-trans-hajin-en: Yesterday, having left me, couldn't be pressed to stay.
Today, still disturbing me, makes me more upset.
The long wind is sending the autumn geese far away
And viewing them from this high tower, we should drink more.
Your essays are fresh and strong like those of the Han dynasty
While my poetry resembles Xie Tiao's in vigor and beauty.
We both have lofty spirit, thinking of soaring
To the sky to grab hold of the clear moon.
I draw my sword to cut water, which won't stop flowing,
And I raise my cup to douse my sorrow, which grows stronger.
Ah, life is such a sad thing that tomorrow
I will undo my hair and sail away in a little boat.
properties.poem-trans-title-hajin-en: Song for Accompanying Uncle Hua on Xie Tiao's Tower

properties.title: Fleeing the An Lushan Rebellion
properties.modern-name: Mount Lu (庐山), Jiujiang (九江市), Jiangxi Province (江西省)

properties.title: Captured and imprisoned as part of Prince Yong's rebel forces
properties.modern-name: Jiujiang (九江市), Jiangxi Province (江西省)

properties.title: Banished to the southwest by the Emperor
properties.modern-name: Fengjie County (奉节县), Chongqing Municipality (重庆市)
poem-trans-hajin-en: In the morning I leave Baidi Town hidden in colored clouds,
Sailing three hundred miles back to Jaingling in a single day.
Before the gibbons on both shores can stop screaming,
My light boat has passed ten thousand hills.
properties.poem-trans-title-hajin-en: Leaving Baidi Town in the Morning

properties.title: Becoming Critically Ill and Bequething his works to Li Yangbing
properties.modern-name: Dangtu (当涂县), Anhui Province (安徽省)

properties.title: Recovering and Revisiting Xuan Town
properties.modern-name: Xuancheng (宣城市), Anhui Province (安徽省)

properties.title: Death
properties.modern-name: Dangtu (当涂县), Anhui Province (安徽省)
poem-trans-hajin-en: The great roc has been soaring all over the sky,
But it breaks a wing mid-flight
Its spirit will inspire a thousand generations,
Though the divine tree in heaven catches its left wings.
People in the future will spread this story,
Yet all saints are dead—who will shed tears for me?
